content:
# List of intents (claim types):

	1. DLUG01 - Damage luggage claim. 
Description:  The passenger files this claim when their checked luggage is damaged during the airlines handling, causing harm to the contents or the bag itself. 
	2.  FLDC02 - Flight Delay Controlled.
Description: The flight was delayed due to the circumstances within the airline's control, the passenger has been informed of the delay less than 12 hours before the departure time on their original ticket, and they have waited at the airport for 4 hours or more after the departure time on your original ticket. 
Those circumstances (possibleValues) are limited to: 
Maintenance issues, Crew scheduling problems, Logistical delays, Ground operations
	3. FDFM03 - Flight Delay force majeure.
Description: a passenger is not entitled to any compensation if the flight was delayed due to the circumstances that are not within the airline's control.
The list of those circumstances (possibleValues) is limited to:
a) Weather conditions: severe weather such as thunderstorms, hurricanes, snowstorms, or dense fog can lead to airport closures, air traffic restrictions, and ultimately flight delays.
b) Security Issues - Unplanned security-related incidents or threats at an airport may lead to temporary closures, resulting in delays for affected flights.
c) Natural disasters - Events such as earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, or tsunamis can disrupt air travel infrastructure and lead to flight delays.
	4.  CAFL04 - Canceled Flight.
Description: The flight was cancelled due to the circumstances within the airline's control, the passenger has been informed of the cancelation less than 12 hours before the departure time on their original ticket.
	5. LOLU05 - Lost Luggage: The luggage is lost.
Description:  The passenger files this claim when their checked luggage is lost during the airlines handling. 

# Details (slots) to be provided with every claim submitted:

• s001 - Passenger’s Name (example_Values: Peter White)
• s002 - Passenger’s phone_number:  (example_Values:  1-800-334-45-02)
• s003 -  reservation number:  consist of 3 uppercase letters and 3 numbers (example_Values: VGH890)
• s004 - ticket_number: 11 digit number (example_Values: 14522764111)
• s005 - airline_name (example_Values: Dream Wings)
• s006 - flight_numbers:  consist of 2 upper case letter and 3 numbers (example_Values: VC456)
• s007 - arrival_city (example_Valuese: Texas)
• s008 - departure_city (example_Values: Texas)
• s009 - notification_date: date when the notification about delayed or canceled flight was issued by the airline and/or received by the passenger (applicable only for FLDC02, FDFM03, CAFL04,  “n/a” if for DLUG01, LOLU05 ). (example_Values: 3:00 pm, 3 hours before the scheduled departure )
• s010 - notification_time - time when the notification about delayed or canceled flight was issued by the airline and/or received by the passenger (applicable only for FLDC02, FDFM03, CAFL04, “n/a” if for DLUG01, LOLU05 ). (example_Values: 3:00 pm, 3 hours before the scheduled departure )
• s011 - delay_period (in hours) (example_Values: 9 hours)
• s012 - Passenger’s email (example_Values: joe.dow@company.com)
• s013 - travel_date (example_Values: 01.01.21, 5th of March 2020)
• S014 - departure_time: the time initially scheduled at the moment of ticket purchase. (example_Values: 4:20 pm)

# Instructions:

Your task will be to assign a relevant intent to the utterance you'll be provided. 
Above is the list of some types of claim cases  (intents) that were submitted by the passengers to airline companies.  There is also a list of important mandatory details (slots) that a customer should include when submitting a claim. Kindly familiarize yourself with the precise definitions of each intent by reviewing the associated descriptions and understanding the constraints for each intent.

Intents: 
Each intent has a unique ID, associated with it, that consists of four uppercase letters, 2 numbers, a name and intent description. It may also include "possibleValues" which means the entity in the utterance must match one of the provided values. 
Slots: For each intent there are also slots associated with them.  Slots are values that need to be retrieved for a particular intent.  Each slot has a unique ID that starts with 1 lower case letter followed by 3 numbers and a name. It could also include a field "example_Values", where examples are given but the extracted slots do not need to exactly match those given values.  

Go through the information available in the customer's claim (the utterance below) and assign the relevant document type. To give the correct answer use the list of the intents (types of claims) provided. If there are multiple intents, that would match the utterance equally well, make sure to output them all.   Also extract all relevant slots and their values. If multiple slots are provided, fill only the slots present in the utterance. You should fill slots in the order they  appeared in the list provided above (going from s001 to s014). If some slots that are present in the utterance were not provided, ignore them and do not extract. 

Return your answer in json.
The JSON should always have a key “output”. The value of “output” should be a dictionary where the key of this dictionary is the intent id and the values is a sub-dictionary where the keys are the slot Ids associated with the given intent and the values are the slot values. If intent can't be identified, please return: {"prediction_intent": "None"}.
Extract the slots and their possible values only if the relevant intent was assigned to the utterance.
Lastly, determine if the emotional tone of the message is "positive", "negative", or "neutral".


# Utterance:

"Hello.
Due to crew scheduling issues my flight # NB871 on 04 April 2022 was delayed  by 7 hours, leading to the loss of my brown suitcase containing some valuable items. And even this suitcase is a very important thing for me! it was a gift from my brother. The delay caused me to miss my  connecting flight in Frankfurt, compounding the inconvenience. I was notified about the delay only 2 hours before the scheduled departure. I'm so angry! This situation is unacceptable!  I want to be compensated for the traumatic experience I endured with your airline. 
Adam."
rejected:
